summary: Led CAD/DFMA, tolerance analysis, and validation for novel UV technology, driving reliability test plans and supplier collaboration that reduced system CAPEX by 35%.
details: Performed engineering design, testing, and validation of patents for novel UV technology.
Led and owned CAD, DFMA, and tolerance stack analysis to ensure manufacturability and repeatable assembly.

Architected and validated rotating electromechanical subsystems under corrosive, sterile, and reliability-critical constraints, including material selection, bearing & seal interfaces, and shaft scoring failure mitigation strategies.

Led cross-functional design reviews and executed reliability and performance test plans, using data-driven analysis to identify risks, debug failures, and drive design iteration for DOD-funded programs.
Served as technical owner for external suppliers, partnering with operations and sourcing teams to refine designs, control tolerances, and achieve over 35% reduction in system CAPEX.
Drove the end-to-end engineering workflow spanning hypothesis generation, experimental design, data analysis, and iterative mechanical design improvements validated through testing.

summary: Designed mechanical architecture for a multidirectional motion platform, cutting size by 47% and weight by 34% through structural optimization and testing.
details: Designed ground-up mechanical architectures for a multidirectional motion platform, enabling precise, repeatable movement for a VR-integrated rehabilitation system.
Reengineered drive systems, reducing size by 47% and improving effectiveness in collaboration with the controls team.
Conducted structural analysis and topological optimization, decreasing weight by 34% while maintaining strength.
Designed load bearing structures subject to dynamic loading and fatigue constraints using FEA.
Led prototype builds and design iteration through hands-on testing and assembly feedback.

summary: Optimized oxygen concentrator mechanics and airflow, improving compressor efficiency by 13% and reducing exhaust re-entry by 70%.
details: Designed and optimized mechanical components and assembly process, reducing overall system size by 7%.
Developed and validated airflow and cooling design improvements, including a variable fan solution that increased compressor efficiency by 13% and reduced exhaust re-entry by 70%.
Optimized the component placement using DFMA principles to increase ease of manufacturing and serviceability.
Owned BOM tracking, fabrication, and assembly workflows, ensuring conformance to design specifications, quality standards, and on-time delivery of production systems.
Served as technical liaison between engineering, vendors, and manufacturing teams to resolve build and quality issues.
Coordinated and supported inspection and validation, including non-destructive testing and pressure testing, to verify structural integrity and safety.
